info.title: Audio Generation, Processing & Reading Test API
info.description:
## ðŸŽµðŸ“š Advanced Audio & Reading Test Generation API

    **Complete solution** for audio generation, format conversion, and CEFR-based reading test creation.

    ### âœ¨ Audio Generation Features
    - **16+ Predefined Conversation Styles** - From casual chats to academic lectures
    - **6 Voice Options** - Multiple neural voices (male & female)
    - **Custom Style Instructions** - Override styles with custom directions
    - **Multi-Speaker Conversations** - Generate dialogues with different voices
    - **Advanced Segment Control** - Fine-tune individual segments
    - **Transcript Output** - Get full text alongside audio URLs

    ### ðŸ”„ Audio Conversion Features
    - **Format Support** - WAV, MP3, OPUS, OGG, FLAC, AAC conversion
    - **Quality Control** - Customizable bitrate and sample rate
    - **URL & Upload** - Convert from URLs or direct file uploads
    - **Auto-Detection** - Intelligent source format recognition
    - **Cloud Storage** - Results hosted on Cloudflare R2

    ### ðŸ“– Reading Test Generation Features
    - **CEFR-Based Content** - A1 to C2 level text generation
    - **9 Question Types** - Multiple choice, true/false, fill-in-blanks, matching, etc.
    - **Smart Planning** - AI-generated question plans with optimal point distribution
    - **Flexible Topics** - Articles, news, stories, essays, reports, tutorials
    - **Pydantic Structured** - Fully typed responses for easy integration

    ### ðŸš€ Quick Start
    **Audio Generation:**
    1. **Simple Audio**: Use `/generate/simple` for single-speaker content
    2. **Conversations**: Use `/generate/conversation` for multi-speaker dialogues  
    3. **Advanced Control**: Use `/generate/advanced` for segment-level customization

    **Audio Conversion:**
    1. **URL Conversion**: Use `/convert/audio` to convert from URLs
    2. **File Upload**: Use `/convert/upload` for direct file conversion

    **Reading Tests:**
    1. **Text Only**: Use `/reading/generate-text` for CEFR-based passages
    2. **Complete Test**: Use `/reading/generate-test` for text + questions
    3. **Custom Planning**: Specify CEFR level, topics, and question types

    ### ðŸ“š Explore
    - **`GET /voices`** - See available voice options
    - **`GET /styles`** - Browse conversation styles  
    - **`GET /reading/cefr-levels`** - Available CEFR levels
    - **`GET /reading/question-types`** - Available question types

    ### ðŸ”§ Integration
    All endpoints return structured data with cloud-hosted audio URLs for fast global access.

post.description:
Convert audio files between different formats using advanced audio processing.
    
    **Supported Formats:**
    - **WAV**: Uncompressed, high quality (best for editing/processing)
    - **MP3**: Compressed, good quality, small file size
    - **OPUS**: Modern codec, excellent compression
    - **OGG**: Open source, good compression
    - **FLAC**: Lossless compression, perfect quality
    - **AAC**: Advanced compression, good quality
    
    **Common Use Cases:**
    - **MP3 â†’ WAV**: For audio editing or processing
    - **WAV â†’ MP3**: To reduce file size for distribution
    - **Any â†’ OPUS**: Modern compression for web streaming
    - **Any â†’ FLAC**: Archival quality preservation
    
    **Quality Settings:**
    - Bitrate: Controls compression vs quality (128k-320k for MP3)
    - Sample Rate: Audio resolution (22050Hz-48000Hz)
    - Auto-detection if not specified
    
    The service downloads the source audio, converts it using high-quality processing, 
    and uploads the result to Cloudflare R2 for fast global access.

200.description: Audio conversion result with converted file URL and metadata

post.description:
Convert an uploaded audio file to a different format.
    
    **Upload Requirements:**
    - Maximum file size: 50MB
    - Supported input formats: MP3, WAV, OPUS, OGG, FLAC, AAC, M4A
    - File must be a valid audio file
    
    **Same conversion capabilities as URL-based conversion:**
    - High-quality format conversion
    - Customizable bitrate and sample rate
    - Automatic format detection
    - Cloud storage hosting of results
    
    **Usage:**
    1. Select your audio file
    2. Choose target format (wav, mp3, opus, etc.)
    3. Optionally specify quality settings
    4. Get back the converted file URL
    
    Perfect for quick one-off conversions or integrating with file upload workflows.

post.description:
Generate a CEFR-level appropriate reading passage on any topic.
    
    **CEFR Levels Supported:**
    - **A1**: Beginner (50-150 words, simple present tense, basic vocabulary)
    - **A2**: Elementary (150-250 words, past/future tenses, everyday topics) 
    - **B1**: Intermediate (250-400 words, complex sentences, abstract concepts)
    - **B2**: Upper-Intermediate (400-600 words, advanced grammar, nuanced vocabulary)
    - **C1**: Advanced (600-800 words, sophisticated language, specialized topics)
    - **C2**: Proficient (800-1200 words, native-like complexity, any topic)
    
    **Text Types:**
    - **Article**: Informative piece on a specific topic
    - **News**: Current events or news-style reporting
    - **Story**: Narrative with characters and plot
    - **Essay**: Argumentative or explanatory text
    - **Report**: Factual analysis or findings
    - **Tutorial**: How-to or instructional content
    
    **Features:**
    - Automatic word count adjustment based on CEFR level
    - Level-appropriate vocabulary and grammar complexity
    - Key vocabulary extraction for learning support
    - Learning objectives tailored to proficiency level
    - Difficulty scoring for assessment
    
    Perfect for creating reading materials for language learning platforms.

Generate a complete reading test with passage and comprehension questions.
    
    **Complete Workflow:**
    1. **Generate Reading Passage** - CEFR-appropriate text on your topic
    2. **Create Question Plan** - AI determines optimal question distribution
    3. **Generate Questions** - Creates varied question types based on the plan
    
    **Question Types Available:**
    - **Multiple Choice**: 4-option questions with distractors
    - **True/False**: Statement verification questions
    - **Fill in Blanks**: Complete sentences with missing words
    - **Checkbox**: Multiple correct answer selection
    - **Matching**: Connect related items or concepts
    - **Short Answer**: 1-3 sentence responses required
    - **Sequence**: Order events or steps correctly
    - **Vocabulary**: Word definition and context questions
    - **Open Ended**: Analytical questions requiring detailed responses
    
    **Smart Features:**
    - **Automatic Point Distribution** - Assigns points based on question complexity
    - **Focus Area Planning** - Ensures comprehensive coverage of the text
    - **Progressive Difficulty** - Questions increase in complexity appropriately
    - **CEFR Alignment** - Question language matches reading level
    
    **Perfect For:**
    - Language learning platforms
    - Educational assessment tools
    - Reading comprehension testing
    - CEFR level evaluation

200.description: Complete reading test with passage and questions

get.description:
Get all available CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference) levels.
    
    **CEFR Levels:**
    - **A1 (Beginner)**: Basic user, can understand simple everyday expressions
    - **A2 (Elementary)**: Basic user, can understand frequently used expressions  
    - **B1 (Intermediate)**: Independent user, can understand main points of clear input
    - **B2 (Upper-Intermediate)**: Independent user, can understand complex text
    - **C1 (Advanced)**: Proficient user, can understand demanding, longer texts
    - **C2 (Proficient)**: Proficient user, can understand virtually everything
    
    Each level has specific vocabulary, grammar, and text complexity requirements
    that are automatically applied during content generation.

200.description: List of available CEFR levels with descriptions

get.description:
Get all available question types for reading comprehension tests.
    
    **Question Types by Complexity:**
    
    **Basic (1-2 points):**
    - **Multiple Choice**: Select one correct answer from 4 options
    - **True/False**: Verify if statements are correct based on text
    - **Fill in Blanks**: Complete sentences with missing words
    - **Vocabulary**: Define words based on context
    
    **Intermediate (2-3 points):**
    - **Checkbox**: Select multiple correct answers from options
    - **Matching**: Connect related concepts, definitions, or examples
    - **Short Answer**: Provide brief 1-3 sentence responses
    - **Sequence**: Order events, steps, or information correctly
    
    **Advanced (3-5 points):**
    - **Open Ended**: Analytical questions requiring detailed responses
    
    Points are automatically assigned based on question complexity and cognitive load.

get.description:
## ðŸ“– Complete Guide to Reading Test Generation
    
    This comprehensive guide covers all aspects of the CEFR-based reading test generation system.
    
    ### ðŸŽ¯ Overview
    The reading test generation system creates authentic, CEFR-aligned content for language learning and assessment. It supports all proficiency levels from A1 (Beginner) to C2 (Proficient) with intelligent question generation.
    
    ### ðŸš€ Quick Start Examples
    
    **Generate Simple A2 Reading Text:**
    ```bash
    curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/reading/generate-text" \
      -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
      -d '{
        "topic": "Travel",
        "text_type": "article",
        "cefr_level": "A2"
      }'
    ```
    
    **Generate Complete B1 Test:**
    ```bash
    curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/reading/generate-test" \
      -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
      -d '{
        "reading_instructions": {
          "topic": "Environment", 
          "text_type": "essay",
          "cefr_level": "B1"
        },
        "question_instructions": {
          "total_points": 15,
          "question_types": ["multiple_choice", "true_false", "short_answer"]
        }
      }'
    ```
    
    ### ðŸ“Š Response Format Examples
    
    **Reading Text Response:**
    ```json
    {
      "title": "Dogs as Family Pets",
      "content": "# Dogs as Family Pets\n\nDogs are popular pets...",
      "key_vocabulary": ["pets", "family", "care", "loyal"],
      "main_concepts": ["Pet ownership", "Animal care"],
      "difficulty_score": 0.2,
      "reading_level": "A2",
      "summary": "Simple text about dogs as pets using basic vocabulary.",
      "learning_objectives": ["Use present tense", "Learn pet vocabulary"]
    }
    ```
    
    **Complete Test Response:**
    ```json
    {
      "reading_text": { /* Reading passage object */ },
      "questions": {
        "multiple_choice": [
          {
            "question": "What do dogs need every day?",
            "options": [
              {"option": "Food and water", "is_correct": true},
              {"option": "Only sleep", "is_correct": false}
            ],
            "explanation": "The text states dogs need daily care.",
            "points": 2,
            "type": "multiple_choice"
          }
        ],
        "true_false": [ /* True/false questions */ ]
      },
      "plan": {
        "total_points": 15,
        "questions": [
          {"question_number": 1, "question_type": "multiple_choice", "focus_area": "main ideas", "points": 2}
        ]
      }
    }
    ```
    
    ### ðŸŽ“ Educational Features
    
    **Learning Objectives by Level:**
    - **A1**: Basic vocabulary, present tense, simple sentences
    - **A2**: Past/future tenses, everyday topics, compound sentences  
    - **B1**: Complex grammar, abstract concepts, inference skills
    - **B2**: Advanced structures, nuanced vocabulary, critical thinking
    - **C1**: Sophisticated language, specialized topics, analysis
    - **C2**: Native-level complexity, cultural references, expertise
    
    **Assessment Types:**
    - **Literal Comprehension**: Direct information from text
    - **Inferential Reading**: Drawing conclusions and implications
    - **Critical Analysis**: Evaluating arguments and perspectives
    - **Vocabulary**: Context-based word understanding
    
    ### ðŸ”§ Best Practices
    
    **Text Generation Tips:**
    1. **Match Level to Audience**: A1-A2 for beginners, B1-B2 for intermediate, C1-C2 for advanced
    2. **Choose Appropriate Topics**: Familiar topics for lower levels, specialized for higher levels
    3. **Use Custom Instructions**: Add specific requirements for targeted learning
    4. **Word Count Guidelines**: Let system auto-adjust or specify within CEFR ranges
    
    **Question Design Tips:**
    1. **Point Distribution**: Mix question types for comprehensive assessment  
    2. **Progressive Difficulty**: Start with literal, progress to analytical
    3. **Balanced Coverage**: Test different parts of the text equally
    4. **Clear Instructions**: Ensure questions are unambiguous
    
    ### ðŸ“ˆ Integration Examples
    
    **Language Learning Platform:**
    ```python
    # Generate daily reading for students
    reading = await generate_reading_text({
        "topic": "Current Events",
        "text_type": "news", 
        "cefr_level": student.level,
        "target_audience": f"{student.level} language learners"
    })
    ```
    
    **Assessment System:**
    ```python
    # Create placement test
    test = await generate_complete_test({
        "reading_instructions": {
            "topic": "General Knowledge",
            "cefr_level": "B2",
            "text_type": "article"
        },
        "question_instructions": {
            "total_points": 20,
            "additional_instructions": "Focus on academic skills"
        }
    })
    ```
    
    ### âš¡ Performance Notes
    
    **Response Times:**
    - **Text Generation**: ~20-30 seconds
    - **Complete Test**: ~2-3 minutes (involves multiple AI steps)
    - **Configuration**: <1 second
    
    **Processing Steps for Complete Tests:**
    1. Generate CEFR-appropriate reading passage
    2. Analyze content for optimal question planning
    3. Create individual questions based on plan
    4. Validate and structure final response
    
    ### ðŸ”— Related Endpoints
    - **GET /reading/cefr-levels**: View all proficiency levels
    - **GET /reading/question-types**: See available question formats
    - **POST /reading/generate-text**: Create reading passages only
    - **POST /reading/generate-test**: Generate complete assessments
